TopicTitle: [1.12.x] CryoTanks: Liquid Hydrogen storage and management (Oct 25, 2021)

Articles.Content:
43 minutes ago, Nertea said:

A more limited approach to at least inform the user that something is wrong might be more possible. 

This is more what I (being a firm CryoTanks user) lean towards naturally. Basically a "sucks to suck" approach that maybe throws an MM warning on load that "Cryo-Tanks is not compatible with X-fuel-switching-mod and will be disabled."

Just that that approach leaves certain players out of luck and having to decide which mod they can live without. I would hope that if that was the end result, it was because other options were explored first, and I know there are several plugin developers out there that might have some creative tricks up their sleeves.

On 5/11/2021 at 11:53 AM, Nertea said:

[tank mod compatibility discussion]

I believe for some tank mods (absolutely for MFT, I believe for Configurable Containers (I've asked on Discord)) masses and such can be set in an MM config, so for those simply publish an MMConfig that automatically configures for cryotanks. For mods that cannot be configured like this and/or mess with the resources themselves or break CRP, throw a warning of non-compatibility.

Not sure what else you could really do or be expected to do
Is the LH2 resource the same one that mods like BDB use? So  will the LH2 engines with BDB work with these tanks and on the other hand, will CryoEngines engines work with BDB tanks using LH2?

1 hour ago, adsuri said:

Is the LH2 resource the same one that mods like BDB use? So  will the LH2 engines with BDB work with these tanks and on the other hand, will CryoEngines engines work with BDB tanks using LH2?

Yes. They both use CRP Liquid Hydrogen. You should have no issues.
is this mod compatible with interstellar fuel switch ?

6 hours ago, Startpanikin1 said:

is this mod compatible with interstellar fuel switch ?

No because it uses B9PartSwitch. They don`t work together.
It'll work, it just won't work properly.

Hi there, is it possible to configure these tanks to hold LF? I am using kerbal atomics with the extra to convert them to run on LF and i would like to use these tanks but they only hold LH2/LH2Ox/CH4/CH4Ox/Ox.

@Nertea

I think I found 2 cryo tanks with texture clipping.

H375-72 Cryogenic Fuel Tank, both Isohedral[Compact] and Isohedral[Bare]. There is clippin at the bottom

Spoiler

and

H500-144 Cryogenic Fuel Tank both in Gold foil and Isogedral in the full version and the compact one

It looks like the texture is inside out.

Spoiler

 

Edited June 23, 2021 by konsti156
I'm going to level with you, the models are all just garbagey now and need some serious update work.

On 6/24/2021 at 6:08 AM, Lady_Lagsalot said:

Hi there, is it possible to configure these tanks to hold LF? I am using kerbal atomics with the extra to convert them to run on LF and i would like to use these tanks but they only hold LH2/LH2Ox/CH4/CH4Ox/Ox.

Yes.  You'll need a good text editor.  I recommed Notepad++. B9PartSwitch is a little hairy to patch but it is possible.

I'm running the latest version of Cryogenic engines with Cryotanks, but the tanks holds LH and O or LM and O separated, I need to use one tank for LM/LH and another for O. I suppose that's not the way that the mod works. Any idea. I can provide more info if needed.

22 hours ago, Yukkine said:

I'm running the latest version of Cryogenic engines with Cryotanks, but the tanks holds LH and O or LM and O separated, I need to use one tank for LM/LH and another for O. I suppose that's not the way that the mod works. Any idea. I can provide more info if needed.

Each mix needs to be defined specifically and set up appropriately. I don't aim to provide all possible permutations in this mod, so you're on your own from a specific standpoint of this question. However, by inspecting https://github.com/post-kerbin-mining-corporation/CryoTanks/blob/master/GameData/CryoTanks/Patches/CryoTanksFuelTankTypes.cfg and https://github.com/post-kerbin-mining-corporation/CryoTanks/blob/master/GameData/CryoTanks/Patches/CryoTanksFuelTankSwitcher.cfg you should be able to work out how to do this yourself.

So to be clear, that's how the mod is intended to work, a tank for LH or LM and another for the O, it doesn't hold both on a single tank, I need to write my own configs then. I'll check the links anyway.

 

Edit: What I'm trying to say is that in game, none of the tanks holds LH2Ox or CH4Ox. Only each one separately

Edited July 16, 2021 by Yukkine
Forgot information

8 hours ago, Yukkine said:

So to be clear, that's how the mod is intended to work, a tank for LH or LM and another for the O, it doesn't hold both on a single tank, I need to write my own configs then. I'll check the links anyway.

 

Edit: What I'm trying to say is that in game, none of the tanks holds LH2Ox or CH4Ox. Only each one separately

Ok that's not correct, I read that you wanted a LH2/LCH4 tank.

You probably have a conflicting mod like IFS.

3 hours ago, Nertea said:

Ok that's not correct, I read that you wanted a LH2/LCH4 tank.

You probably have a conflicting mod like IFS.

Yeah that's what I thought, just deleted IFS and didn't work, I suspect that the issue is with Tundra Exploration.

4 hours ago, Nertea said:

Ok that's not correct, I read that you wanted a LH2/LCH4 tank.

You probably have a conflicting mod like IFS.

It wasn't Tundra, can you check my mod list to see which one is causing the issue?

https://imgur.com/g5T4Qst

Edited July 16, 2021 by Yukkine

So, here's the problem, there's a folder inside Warplugin/Patches/B9PartSwitch (IE parts) that has Cryotanks patches and those where the ones that the game was applying, just copied the patches from Cryotanks/Patches to that folder and now I have CH4O and LH2O tanks, of anyone else face the same issue as me, that's the solution.
Ah yeah... honestly I can't guarantee functionality of any of my mods in a save that contains KSPIE.

CryoTanks 1.6.1

  • Updated DynamicBatteryStorage to 2.2.4
  • Updated B9PartSwitch to 2.18.0
  • Improved the ISRU patches for LH2, LCH4, and combos thereof (yalov)
  • Improvements to Procedural Parts patches (tomasbrod)

I myself found B9PartSwitch configs conflicting (likely because KSPI) with this mod's cfg.  I'm just going to provide the 2 cfgs if anyone else is interested looking at them / merging. @Nertea  As i can see they tried to adapt your config but maybe things changed since then, CH4Ox is missing for me too. 

https://ufile.io/romalk63

https://imgur.com/a/SuLrVtD

Just putting this here as I think it is the right place.

I noticed the error after the recent ModuleManager update.

Let me know if you need any log.

Does this persist after MM 4.2.1?

2 hours ago, Nertea said:

Does this persist after MM 4.2.1?

No, no errors anymore to be seen.

Also the LH2 and LCH4 options for the Convert-O-Tron are back wich I noticed went missing related to the error.

All works now again I guess, thanks!

Hi. 1.6.1 was also messing with this little mod I've made for my personal use

And it's also probably causing conflicts with Rational Resources

I've solved it by simply adding the code so LSI loads after Cryotanks, but you might want the heads up
